description: Even if you only make pancakes once a year, a good, stress-free recipe will help you to cook them with style!
name: French Crêpes Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Sift the flour into a large jug. Add the eggs and 4 tbsp of the milk and, using an electric hand-held whisk, whisk well to combine.

Gradually add the remaining milk, whisking constantly. Stir in both the melted butter and 75ml of cold water. Whisk well to give a thin, smooth batter. Set aside to rest for 30 minutes, covered with a clean tea towel.
Brush the base of an 18cm non-stick frying pan with a little oil. Heat over a high temperature on the hob.

Carefully pour in just enough batter to coat the base of the pan and swirl the pan to give an even layer of batter. Cook for 40-60 seconds or until the pancake is set. Flip over using a palette knife and cook the other side; reducing the hob temperature if the pancake is browning too quickly.

Remove from the pan and place on a warmed plate. Repeat to cook 7 more pancakes, occasionally brushing the pan with more oil. Stack the pancakes up, ideally with a sheet of greaseproof paper between each, and cover the stack with foil to keep them all warm. Serve the pancakes with bowls containing the banana, apple, and walnut fillings.
